udp.name: User Datagram Protocol
udp.description: Connectionless transport layer protocol for fast, unreliable data transmission
risks: No congestion control leading to network flooding
Vulnerable to UDP flooding DDoS attacks
No sequence numbers enabling packet injection

tcp.name: Transmission Control Protocol
tcp.description: Connection-oriented, reliable transport layer protocol with error checking and flow control
risks: Port scanning techniques (SYN, ACK, FIN scans)

tls.name: Transport Layer Security
tls.description: Cryptographic protocol designed to provide communications security over a computer network

http.name: Hypertext Transfer Protocol
http.description: Protocol for transferring web pages and data between browsers and servers

https.name: HTTP Secure
https.description: Encrypted version of HTTP using TLS/SSL for secure web communication

ftp.name: File Transfer Protocol
ftp.description: Protocol for transferring files between systems

sftp.name: SSH File Transfer Protocol
sftp.description: Secure file transfer protocol using SSH encryption

telnet.name: Telnet Protocol
telnet.description: Protocol for remote terminal access to network devices

ssh.name: Secure Shell
ssh.description: Encrypted protocol for secure remote access and command execution

rlogin.name: Remote Login
rlogin.description: Remote login protocol for Unix systems

smtp.name: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
smtp.description: Protocol for sending email messages between servers

pop3.name: Post Office Protocol v3
pop3.description: Protocol for retrieving email from a mail server

imap.name: Internet Message Access Protocol
imap.description: Protocol for accessing email on a remote server

dns.name: Domain Name System
dns.description: Protocol for translating domain names to IP addresses

dhcp.name: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol
dhcp.description: Protocol for automatically assigning IP addresses to network devices

llmnr.name: Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution
llmnr.description: Protocol that allows IPv4 and IPv6 hosts to perform name resolution for hosts on the same local link without a DNS server
risks: Spoofing attacks allowing attackers to poison LLMNR responses
Credential theft via responder tools that capture NTLMv2 hashes
Broadcast/multicast traffic can be monitored by any local host
Often enabled by default on Windows systems
Can be used for NetNTLM relay attacks
Provides fallback mechanism when DNS fails, expanding attack surface

tftp.name: Trivial File Transfer Protocol
tftp.description: Simplified file transfer protocol without authentication

finger.name: Finger Protocol
finger.description: Protocol for looking up user information

snmp.name: Simple Network Management Protocol
snmp.description: Protocol for managing and monitoring network devices

snmp-trap.name: SNMP Trap
snmp-trap.description: SNMP notifications sent by agents to managers

ntp.name: Network Time Protocol
ntp.description: Protocol for synchronizing clocks across network devices

nntp.name: Network News Transfer Protocol
nntp.description: Protocol for reading and posting Usenet articles

ldap.name: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
ldap.description: Protocol for accessing and maintaining directory information services

ldaps.name: LDAP over SSL/TLS
ldaps.description: Secure version of LDAP using SSL/TLS encryption

rpcbind.name: RPC Port Mapper
rpcbind.description: Service for mapping RPC program numbers to port numbers

mysql.name: MySQL Database Protocol
mysql.description: Protocol for communicating with MySQL database servers

rdp.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
rdp.description: Microsoft protocol for remote desktop access

vnc.name: Virtual Network Computing
vnc.description: Protocol for remote desktop sharing and control

samba.name: Server Message Block (SMB)
samba.description: Protocol for file and printer sharing

icmp.name: Internet Control Message Protocol
icmp.description: Protocol for sending error messages and operational information

igmp.name: Internet Group Management Protocol
igmp.description: Protocol for managing multicast group memberships

bgp.name: Border Gateway Protocol
bgp.description: Protocol for exchanging routing information between networks

sip.name: Session Initiation Protocol
sip.description: Protocol for VoIP call setup and management

rtp.name: Real-time Transport Protocol
rtp.description: Protocol for delivering audio and video streams

rtsp.name: Real Time Streaming Protocol
rtsp.description: Protocol for controlling streaming media servers

xmpp.name: Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol
xmpp.description: Protocol for instant messaging and presence

gitlab.name: GitLab
gitlab.description: Git repository management and CI/CD platform

prometheus.name: Prometheus
prometheus.description: Monitoring system and time series database

splunk.name: Splunk
splunk.description: Data platform for searching and analyzing logs

fluentd.name: Fluentd
fluentd.description: Data collector for unified logging layer

nginx.name: Nginx
nginx.description: High-performance web server and reverse proxy

opnsense.name: OPNsense
opnsense.description: Open source firewall and routing platform

bacnet.name: Building Automation and Control Networks
bacnet.description: Protocol for building automation and control systems

modbus.name: Modbus Protocol
modbus.description: Industrial communication protocol for PLCs and SCADA

idrac.name: Dell Integrated Dell Remote Access Controller

afp.name: Apple Filing Protocol
afp.description: Apple's proprietary network protocol for file services

upnp.name: Universal Plug and Play
upnp.description: Protocol for device discovery and control on networks

ws-discovery.name: Web Services Dynamic Discovery
ws-discovery.description: Protocol for discovering services on a network

coap.name: Constrained Application Protocol
coap.description: Web transfer protocol for IoT and constrained devices

mqtt.name: Message Queuing Telemetry Transport
mqtt.description: Lightweight messaging protocol for IoT devices

haproxy.name: HAProxy
haproxy.description: High availability load balancer and proxy server

vault.name: HashiCorp Vault
vault.description: Secrets management and data protection service

harbor.name: Harbor Registry
harbor.description: Cloud native registry for container images

sonarqube.name: SonarQube
sonarqube.description: Code quality and security analysis platform

metasploit.name: Metasploit Framework
metasploit.description: Penetration testing and exploit development platform
